author: Jessica Gibb
title: Piers Morgan left red-faced after checking his phone live on Good Morning Britain
text:
Piers Morgan was left red-faced on Good Morning Britain earlier today. 
Susanna Reid started to welcome viewers back from an ad break – but was distracted by Piers scrolling through his phone. 
She then stopped the link to tell her co-host off for using his phone live on air. Read More Piers Morgan caught using his phone on GMB (Photo: ITV) 
“Are you just popping your phone away?” she said. 
And red-faced Piers was left trying to explain his rude behaviour. 
“You know, sometimes I think they’re going over there and I’m having a little chat with the viewers on Twitter and then I get caught and it all looks rather embarrassing," he said. Read More Susanna Reid told Piers Morgan off for being rude (Photo: ITV) 
Ever-patient Susanna suggested: “Shall we have a chat with the viewers on television instead?” 
She then carried on with presenting the show while Piers tried to regain his composure. 
Last week, Piers was booed as he appeared gagged on stage alongside co-host Susanna Reid at the NTAs. Piers Morgan did as he was told (Photo: ITV) 
The two presenters went up on stage to present an award, with Piers sporting a black band of material wrapped around his jaw to stop him talking. 
Speaking about how she'd managed to get Piers to shut up for five minutes, Susanna told the audience: "It's been a controversial week on Good Morning Britain. We've had tears, we've had tantrums – we've even had a walkout. 
"So I've done what people have been urging me to do for some time… I've finally gagged Piers Morgan. Just enjoying this moment." Piers Morgan booed on NTA stage while gagged by Susanna Reid (Photo: ITV) 
The crowd clapped and cheered for Susanna, having booed Piers when he first got up in front of them. 
It came after Piers took his public spat with Ewan McGregor to the next level - by insisting the actor have a fight with him on live TV. 
The controversial host, 51, was filmed on the National Television Awards' red carpet where he was heard telling the Trainspotting performer to "be a man" and debate him. Like us on Facebook
